text: IN DARKNESS, the solitary sound of a HEARTBEAT, resoundin like a drum over the distant sounds of war, STEEL AGAINST STEEL, the crack of bootleather on bone.

Between the years when the oceans drank Atlantis, and the rise of the sons of Aryas, there was an age undreamed of... TILT DOWN to the immaculate crown of an UNBORN BABY, eyes closed, floating at peace within the warm glow of the wom

It was an age of war. And of all Hyboria, none knew war like the Cimmerians... SSSKKTTTCH! A flash of steel as a BLADE PIERCES THE WOMB, an inch from the child. As the sword is pulled free we MO WITH IT, out into the MADNESS OF BATTLE. EXT. CIMMERIA вЂ”- BATTLEFIELD - DAY A VANIR WARRIOR withdraws the stained blade from FIALLA, wild-maned Cimmerian warrior-woman, many months pregnant. From atop a mountain of the dead, CORIN, rallying his CIMMERIAN WARRIORS against the Vanir, spots Fialla fall. Corin races across the battlefield, the FOREST ON FIRE ar him, cutting through those in his way. The battlefield is littered with dead Vanir; by the looks it theyвЂ™ve been fighting over these lands for years. Fialla clutches her belly, looking up at her attacker, he other hand reaching through mud for her lost weapon. Her attacker advances. She DRIVES THE BLADE up into the g in his armor. He HOWLS in agony, raising his sword to fin her off when- HeвЂ™s CLEAVED FROM HELMET TO STERNUM, a geyser of blood bonechips. Corin draws back his blade and kneels beside h fallen wife. Fialla looks down at her bare belly, a visible impression the baby against her flesh. She tries to speak, coughing blood.
Take your child.
Do not speak, love.
You have never been able to still my tongue, and you will not on this day. Fialla grits her bloodstained teeth, drawing a dagger fro her pelt.

I will see my child before I die. Fialla NEVER takes her eyes off Corin, NEVER screams as C performs the horrific task. The sounds of war fade away, more steel, no more screams... Just the sound of a CHILD CRYING. Fialla kisses her newborn, his first taste not of motherв milk, but of her blood.
See that there will be more to his life than fire and blood. No kissing or hugging for these two. Corin and Fialla sha warriorвЂ™s handgrasp, touching forehead to bloody forehe
Name your child...
The air is wild with burning embers from funeral pyres. C stands with his newborn son.
His name is Conan. Corin raises YOUNG CONAN skyward against the pyres ablaze baptism by fire.

SMALL BOOTS race through fresh snow. A BOY, 11 sprints through the village. We donвЂ™t see his face, just his sc frame, black unkempt hair hanging in tangles. The boy cuts through the village center around a large hu leaping over a sitting CIMMERIAN ELDER and a ring of GIRL crafting a ceremonial drum. The Elder looks scandalized. No time to apologize. The boy continues his run, weaving around CIMMERIAN WARRIORS sparring with swords and spears ducking under a large SLAIN ELK being prepped for the spi The village is preparing for a celebration.

The boy clears the village, a haven nestled in heavy fore surrounded by rolling hills and ashen skies. Ahead... Corin, older, limping from a war injury, stands before a of eager CIMMERIAN BOYS, 12-15. A ring of CIMMERIAN ELDER watch this solemn ceremony begin. As if handing out the Eucharist, Corin walks down the lin boys, placing in each oneвЂ™s mouth a small, blue RAVENвЂ The boys hold the fragile orbs delicately between their l

When a Cimmerian feels thirst, it is the thirst for blood. When he feels cold, it is the cold edge of steel. (beat) But, the courage of a Cimmerian is tempered. He neither fears death, nor rushes foolishly to meet it. (beat) So, to be a Cimmerian warrior, you must have cunning and balance as well as strength and speed. Suddenly, the boy blunders up and takes a spot at the end the line. He struggles to catch his breath.
(surprise) Conan? ONLY NOW DO WE SEE CONANвЂ™S FACE. At age 11, the boy has adolescent scrawniness, lacking the swagger or the size o the other boys. They eye him dubiously.
I gave you chores, boy.
Finished, father. Corin studies his sonвЂ™s dark intensity, and then he nod curtly. He places the last egg in ConanвЂ™s mouth.
The first to circle the hills and return, the egg unbroken, earns the right to train with the warriors. A moment as Corin looks over his son.
By Crom, what are you waiting for? AND OFF THEY RUN, a brutal footrace. They struggle to kno each other down, to trip each other in the river, to brea the eggs the others carry in their mouths.

They race along a path towards the hill. A TALL BOY kicks another, whose egg BURSTS as his chin hits the dirt. Then the Tall Boy swings for ConanвЂ™s mouth. Conan ducks stumbles, and nearly falls. But the egg remains unbroken. The bigger boys take the lead, but Conan gains on them by cutting off the trail, hopping over rocks and logs.

Conan takes the lead, with two larger boys right behind h all bounding over roots with remarkable balance. They glide through the harsh wilderness like young wolves careful no false step should break their fragile cargo. But suddenly, around them, there is MOVEMENT IN THE TREES Conan spots BARE FEET leaping among the branches, trackin them. He slows, realizing what this means. The other boys, even the biggest, stop dead, turn and fle rushing back toward the village. But Conan stands his ground. WHOOSH! A BOLA ARCS THROUGH THE FOLIAGE. It snags Conanв feet, drops him face first into the mud. Conan tries to stand, tangled in the snare. He wipes mud his eyes, finds heвЂ™s surrounded by 3 PICT SCOUTS, savag decorated in tribal warpaint, armed with dual handaxes, t rotting heads of their enemies slung at their waists. The Picts make no move, discussing their catch in their native tongue. Conan watches, mouth held shut, struggling with the bola, his expression dark and canny. The PICT LEADER draws a CURVED SKINNING KNIFE, snatches a fist full of ConanвЂ™s hair. He laughs to his fellow scou He doesnвЂ™t notice that Conan has slipped free of the Bo that the weighted end is already rising in a wide arc. CONAN SHATTERS THE LEADERвЂ™S SKULL. With startling speed, Conan grabs the dead PictвЂ™s axe a with a bloodthirsty shriek, leaps towards the two remaini warriors...
As Corin and the elders wait for the boys to return.
Corin! Picts on the trail! The Cimmerian warriors we saw sparring earlier rush up wi all the frightened boys we saw flee from the Pict scouts. All except Conan.

Where? Corin suddenly turns, and everyone follows his eyes, look up the path, but instead of the enemy, they see... CONAN, COVERED IN BLOOD. He walks past the stunned Cimmer boys, past the dumfounded elders, right up to his father. He clutches the SEVERED HEADS of the slain Picts by their hair. He SPITS out the broken shell of the egg, and speak
I am ready to fight. Corin studies the boy, gravely. All stand in awe. Then Co nods to the warriors who rush out onto the trail.

Search the hills. INT. CIMMERIAN VILLAGE - CORINвЂ™S FORGE - NIGHT Corin enters and watches his boy wave a short sword throu the air, lost in fantasies of battle. Corin looks trouble Corin reaches out and grasps the hilt, trying to take the weapon away. For a moment the outraged boy wonвЂ™t let go it only lasts a moment. Coming to his senses, Conan relinquishes the blade and goes back to work.

Remember that you fight not just for yourself. There are secrets hidden here that have the power to change the course of history, and someday they will be your responsibility to protect. Corin opens a WELL HIDDEN DOOR IN THE FLOOR and places th sword back in a cache of weapons, armor and sacred object Conan works the bellows of a complex forge, the walls ado with ARMS AND ARMOR. He looks bored and impatient, starin into the fire, FLAMES REFLECTED IN HIS EYES.
Come. ItвЂ™s time you learned to forge a blade. Corin leads Conan to their anvil, offers Conan the master smithing hammer. Conan doesnвЂ™t take it.
Crom made me to wield swords, not to hammer them.
Crom has shaped you, as he shapes us all, to his own cold ends.

Over the course of many weeks, Corin teaches Conan the ar blacksmithing. Days and nights pass as, - Ore is carted in from the hills, BACK-BREAKING WORK. - Bellows ROAR as the ore is superheated to liquid metal, poured into a mold from an ELABORATE PULLEY SYSTEM.  - The FORGING of the blade, hot iron poured into a mold. - Corin EXAMINES CONANвЂ™S SWORD. Conan is proud of his w
What is most important when forging a blade, fire or ice?
(obviously) Fire. Corin stares. Silence. Conan senses heвЂ™s made a mistake
Ice? Corin continues to stare. Conan looks baffled.

Are you certain? Conan nods, uncertain. Corin sighs, shakes his head, and then STRIKES the anvil the sword. THE BLADE SHATTERS. Conan stares at his own reflection caught in the shards of broken metal.
LetвЂ™s begin again. - RELENTLESS HAMMER WORK, Corin and Conan pound the metal together, backlit by the forge. Sparks fly.
This sword we make will be yours one day. But before you wield it, you must understand it. - The blade is HEATED until it glows.
A sword must bend or it will break. - The blade is QUENCHED. Steam rises from the cooling tub
It must be tempered... - Conan watches Corin etch the pommel of the CIMMERIAN GREATSWORD. A work of art.
Fire and ice. Together. This is the mystery of steel.

Conan and Corin spar atop an ice sheet over a shallow riv For his age, Conan is quite the warrior, and he shows it. But, his father, the master warrior, wielding the new greatsword, easily deflects his every blow. ItвЂ™s like n Conan has ever faced before.
You are STILL all fire, boy. Frustrated, Conan just swings harder, struggling for bala as his feet slip and slide on the ice.
No. Slow down. Find your footing. Corin sidesteps a clumsy thrust, knocks Conan off his fee spreading cracks across the ice.
(shaking his head) Enough. But Conan isnвЂ™t finished. What he lacks in skill he del in ferocity, slashing and charging. But, with two flowing strokes Corin knocks the boy back.

Corin PLUNGES HIS GREATSWORD into the cracked ice sheet, Arthur returning the sword to the stone. In an explosion of sudden anger and frustration, Conan CHARGES HIS FATHER with his sword. Corin calmly pulls bac his blade stuck in the ice sheet. CorinвЂ™s blade works like a lever, cracking the ice furt And just as Conan reaches him. CRACK! The ice splits. Conan DROPS INTO THE SHALLOW RIVER Corin glares. Conan pulls himself out of the frigid water see his father sheathing the blade he wants so badly.

(with disappointment) You are not ready for this sword. Humiliated, Conan turns and bolts towards the hills. Corin watches him go, then walks somberly to the village. However, as the wind picks up, he sniffs as if sensing something in the air. Perhaps a coming storm.

Conan, hair still soaked, races past snow covered pines, slashing limbs, causing a rain of shattered ice crystals. Conan sits at the hilltop looking out over the slopes and sombre hills of Cimmeria. A long beat as he broods. A sudden gust of icy wind. Conan senses something. He listens. Something in the dist CRACKS like a whip, and panicked birds race across the sk Far below, he sees a line of DARK RIDERS galloping ominou towards the tiny village. A rumble like thunder. Then, from the south, a swarm of lighted arrows rise brig against the ashen sky, arc slowly and fall on the thatche rooftops, setting them aflame. Conan gawks, stunned. And then he RUNS...

As Conan races home, MOUNTED TURANIANS, scouts for the invading army, ride towards him, hooves kicking up powder He ducks into the cover of the forest. The riders spur on their horses and pass by. Conan stays low, taking his shortcut through the wilderness.

Conan bushwhacks his way back to the village. As he gets closer, the forest darkens, thick with BLACK SMOKE. He slides down a snowbank, racing across the small river running from his village, waist deep before he realizes.. THE RIVER RUNS RED WITH BLOOD.  10

Conan bursts through the treeline out into an open field. Ahead, his village is in flames. Cimmerian warriors, both and women form defensive lines. And behind him... AQUILONIAN BRIGADES COME CHARGING - bandit knights who fi with polished shields and short swords. ConanвЂ™s shortcu placed him smack in the middle of the invasion. He sprints for the village as the mounted riders converge around him. Conan swerves to avoid being trampled. On foo these men would be twice his size. On horseback, theyвЂ™r armored juggernauts towering over him. And then, he sees the most terrible sight of all. A RIDER EMERGES FROM A CLOUD OF BLACK SMOKE, an angel of death wearing green leather armor and bearing a shield ma with the ACHERONIAN SEAL. This is the brigand-leader KHALAR ZYM. EXT. CIMMERIAN VILLAGE - CORINвЂ™S FORGE - DAY Leading a band of strong Cimmerian warriors, Corin drives first wave of Aquilonians back. The old master swordsman takes down two attackers himself. But more and MORE keep coming.

As Conan enters the village, he sees FOUR tribes assault people from different directions. KUSH SPEARMEN, muscled warriors wearing the bones of slaughtered victims, assault the Cimmerians from the flan TURANIAN raiders swarm the opposite flank. The AQUILONIAN knights have crossed the moat, pushing the defending Cimmerians back. BRYTHUNIAN ARCHERS, amazons augmented for ranged combat, pepper the village with arrows. THUNK! THUNK! THUNK! The arrows stick into Cimmerian shields. Conan keeps running.  11 As the boy passes an unsuspecting Aquilonian, he grabs th warrior, spins him into the path of the arrows. The Aquilonian gets skewered, Conan snatches his shortsword. SLAM! Conan is knocked down by a Kush warrior. Conan spin avoid a spear attack, driving his blade into the warriorв gut. The spearman crumbles. And Conan springs back to his feet.

The air thick with smoke, the snow rich with blood. So ma Cimmerians have fallen. ItвЂ™s a massacre. And still the invaders come, unmerciful and relentless. Conan sprints to the forge, one of the few buildings not burning, but the open door reveals it is full of enemies. Looking through the cracks between wall boards, Conan see his father surrounded by the leaders of each enemy tribe. INT. CIMMERIAN VILLAGE - CORINвЂ™S FORGE - CONANвЂ™S POV ItвЂ™s difficult to hear what is being said. One by one, scans the faces of each tribal leader. AKHOUN, a Turanian, four hundred pounds of corpulent fles not so much armored as wrapped in chain. CHERIN, the Brythunian, looks statuesque and imposing. LUCIUS, the Aquilonian leader, corpulent and vain, who ro and cracks his neck in a distinctive manner. He holds the leash of a growling wolfhound. UKAFA, a Kush chieftain wielding an enormous mace lined w sharpened bones and rusted metal. REMO, a crippled hunchback, and with him an acolyte barin the invadersвЂ™ standard, a death mask made of shards of
And lastly, Khalar Zym himself, an exiled prince from the lands of Nemedia; Khalar may look like a brigand, but he speaks as eloquently as a prince.
There is no shame in kneeling before me. All these fighters have surrendered, left their lands and sworn their allegiance to me. (MORE)

(beat) TheyвЂ™ve done so because they know I will one day be a god. Corin stares calmly in KhalarвЂ™s face, but Conan sees, a Corin turns, that his fatherвЂ™s shoulder has been pierce an arrow, and his back is wet with blood.
One day, the other clans of Cimmeria will gather for vengeance. Then, god or not, you shall fall. Khalar rolls his eyes. He hears this all the time. Then h indicates the strange mask of bone.
There is one piece missing from this mask. Give it to me now... or die, and I'll find it myself. Corin just smiles defiantly.

I prefer death. Lucius steps up, raises his short sword to behead him. And then, CONAN BURSTS IN like a wild animal. WHOOSH! A blade SLASHES LUCIUSвЂ™ NOSE CLEAR OFF. He tumb backward, grabbing for his severed nose, failing to snatc before the wolfhound DEVOURS IT. Then Conan POUNCES, blade thrust at Khalar. But Khalar is too fast. He deflects the blade, though the strike carries such ferocity that Khalar is knocked back, sword grazing his ear, DRAWING BLOOD. Ukafa and Remo seize Conan. Corin lunges to defend his so but he is clubbed down by Akhoun. Khalar catches his own blood in his palm, shocked, but IMPRESSED. He smiles.
Is that your son? I LIKE HIM.

Akhoun binds Corin to the forge, a fiery vat of molten st suspended precariously above him.  13 Khalar pokes a support chain and the vat wobbles. A tiny of molten metal spills from the brim and falls on CorinвЂ shoulder, burning and bubbling through his flesh like aci But the gritty Cimmerian does NOT cry out in pain.
Such a waste. Think of the power I could have shared with you.

Cimmerians have no use for sorcery. Conan is pinned to the floor by the strong chieftain, Uka Lucius presses blood soaked rags to his ruined face. Remo and Cherin ransack the forge, turning it inside out.
The bone shard is not here.

You just donвЂ™t know how to look. Stepping eerily from the shadows where she had been lurki all along, is KhalarвЂ™s daughter, MARIQUE, 13. Her face is uncanny; with no eyebrows and a hairline high above her forehead, she looks both regal and serpentine.

Your son has courage, but my daughter has talents as well. (beat) Where is it, Marique? KhalarвЂ™s lieutenants are clearly unnerved by the little She dangles her long fingers along the ransacked arms and armor, as if she had some sixth sense in her fingertips.

The Cimmerians do not pray. They have no priests or preachers. Closing her eyes she SNIFFS, as if catching an intriguing scent, and she feels along the walls like a blind girl exploring the face of a lover.

This is what matters to them. This is their church. It will be here... Her witch-eye flashing magically, Marique discovers the hidden door in the floor. She opens it.  14 Conan sees his father clench his teeth and wince. The boy tries to squirm out of UkafaвЂ™s grip but is held fast. MariqueвЂ™s spidery fingers probe the weapons in the secr cache. She gasps suddenly and smiles. From the cache, she pulls out a LUMP OF ORE, brings it cl to her face to sniff it and to probe it with her tongue. Then she crosses the forge and places the ore in the furn All watch as the ore heats and rapidly loses its shape. A SHARD OF BONE rises to the surface. The girl reaches in, and with two budding black nails, pointed as needles, she picks out BONE FRAGMENT. Sharp as and white as death, it mysteriously cools before their ey

Your mother would be proud. The men stand back in deference as she crosses and hands the shard to her father. Khalar looks at it with a kind of religious awe. His eyes water. His hands actually tremble as he grasps it. But then he steels himself.
Gather the men. Burn everything. Lucius moves to impale Conan.
Wait. Not him. Not yet.
Not yet? HE CUT OFF MY NOSE! KhalarвЂ™s other henchmen toss torches against the far wa The forge catches aflame. Khalar locks eyes with Corin.

How do I punish you Cimmerian? You fear not death, nor pain, nor insult to honor. Marique whispers in her fatherвЂ™s ear, making him smile. Khalar hacks at a support chain. The vat of SUPERHEATED M begins to tip toward Corin.  15 Conan SNATCHES the stabilizing chain, grimacing as the li heated from the fire, SIZZLES into the flesh of his palms

Something worse than death. Watch your son die because he loves you. Khalar exits, his men follow. Marique, the last to go. She lingers at CorinвЂ™s greatsword, awed by the craftsma She runs her finger perversely over the edge, slicing her fingertip. The sting seems to please her. Smiling sadistically, she steals the blade and goes. Cona incensed, but helpless: if he lets go of the chain, his father will die in a shower of molten metal. EXT. CIMMERIAN VILLAGE - CORINвЂ™S FORGE - DAY Flames sweep over the walls and rooftop, swiftly becoming raging inferno.

Khalar Zym stands, surrounded by his victorious army, and is joined by his daughter. Remo hands him the MASK OF ACHERON, a jigsaw puzzle of ma bone fragments, arranged in a white mask of death. With bated breath, Khalar inserts the recovered shard int the mask. It fits perfectly. The mask is complete. Khalar RAISES THE MASK OF ACHERON. His mercenary army CHE

We are halfway there, Marique. Now we must find the pureblood, and then, your mother will return. INT. CIMMERIAN VILLAGE - CORINвЂ™S FORGE - DAY Conan struggles to keep the vat of molten ore from tippin If he lets go, his father dies. If he doesnвЂ™t let go, t SPREADING FLAMES will kill them both.
Conan, you cannot save me.  16 Conan struggles with the chain, his hands smoldering. A droplet of molten steel falls from the vat, searing his c but he does not loosen his grip.
Let go of the chain, boy. ConanвЂ™s losing ground, his heels sliding through the di won't look Corin in the eye.
IвЂ™m not afraid to die.

Nor I. But, I watched your mother die so you could live. But Conan will not let go. He will never let go. And Cori knows this, watching the fire spread around them, blister the skin of ConanвЂ™s back.
Conan... LOOK AT ME. The boy looks in his fatherвЂ™s eyes.

She wanted more for you, in this life, than fire and blood. (beat) I love you, son. Corin uses the last of his strength to pull the chain fro ConanвЂ™s hands. The vat of ore spills down, a TORRENT OF ENVELOPING CONANвЂ™S FATHER.
Conan crawls from the runoff through the snow toward the frozen river. He plunges his hands into the water. As he pulls his hands free, he looks at his palms. The ch has been branded into his flesh.

Conan stumbles back into the village. The bodies of every he knew, litter the ground. In a grim echo of the scene o his birth, all the buildings are aflame. His blue eyes are wide with the shock of innocence lost.  17 Looking down, he sees a Cimmerian sword sunk, point first into the snow. He grabs the hilt and drags it like a stic The boy walks on, in shock, and a lingering Turanian Raid looting a corpse, looks up and sees him approaching. Sensing an easy kill, the Turanian springs towards the bo but Conan snaps out of his trance and CUTS HIM DOWN. Then the boy runs wildly forward, HOWLING WITH RAGE. With wiry, adolescent arm, he RAISES THE BLADE IN THE AIR.

The SAME SWORD RAISED HIGH IN THE AIR, but the arm that h it is massive, muscled, and scarred. CONAN, the fully grown icon we all recognize, CHARGES dow hill on horseback, leading a crew of Zingaran pirates. ARTUS, a dashing captain of Zingaran pirates, rides along him, unleashing a lusty battle cry. Around them a dozen BOULDERS roll downhill like tumblewee It's a wild frenzy of energy, motion and aggression.

A SLAVE CARAVAN rolls across broken earth. SLAVEGIRLS, na save for their loincloths and the chains that bind them, packed in caged wagons, sheltered from the midday sun. The MALE SLAVES walk alongside the wagon, their feet blistered, skin blacked, and flesh lean from hard labor. A rumble like an earthquake. The HEAD SLAVER looks up, confused as the ground itself seems to be HURLING TOWARD BOOM! A boulder CRUSHES the slaver, crashing into the caravan, sending the horses into a frenzy, spilling loot across the road. BOOM! BOOM! More boulders tear through wagons and shatter carts of food. Then the Zingaran pirates swarm, waving their steel. Most of the slavers take one look at their attackers and FLEE, abandoning their caravan. Artus howls with laughter

Come back and fight! You pink- bellied, stub-cocked, goat lovers!  18 Conan gallops alongside a caged wagon, past spellbound sl girls gaping at the sight of him. He swats a slaver off h mount sending him head first into the sand. The Zingaran pirates ride in circles, whooping, screaming and beating their chests. The few remaining slavers give and ride away in panic and terror... В«+. all except one. The largest slaver, THE WILD MAN, hi simian arms, hairy back, ratty beard and blackened teeth. With a ferocious shriek, the Wild Man CHARGES AT CONAN AN ARTUS. The two men study him curiously as he gallops.
Are you going to take this one?
No, you go ahead. The Wild Man rides closer, raising his deadly spear.
I had the troglodyte last week.
Are you sure?

I insist. At the last possible second, Conan calmly ducks a frenzie spear thrust to his face, and lops off the slaverвЂ™s hea As the decapitated body rides on, the severed head twirls the air like a soccer ball and lands in the sand. THUNK! Conan scowls at his sword. Artus mimes his swing.
I think you pulled left.
(shaking his head) The blade is warped. Both pirates and slaves erupt in cheers.
Artus and his pirates loot the caravan of anything and everything of value and load it onto rafts and rowboats. Anchored at bay is their pirate ship, THE HORNET.  19 Conan cuts the slaves free.
Go. You are all free. The slaves look frightened and bewildered. TWO BUXOM SLAV GIRLS steps forward.

But... But you have taken all the food, all the weapons. (beat) Where would you have us go? ItвЂ™s wilderness and unbroken coast in every direction. Conan looks over the slaves. HeвЂ™s right; no food, no we the men wear loincloths, the women wear even less.
You are right... (thinking) The women will come with us.

SLAVE GIRLS GONE WILD. They dangle from hanging lanterns, dance on table tops, and pour ale into mugs for the randy pirate crew. The air is thick with smoke. Two women, painted and naked, writhe on ArtusвЂ™s lap. On waif, petite and pert, who feeds him dates. KEERRRACK! A portly GOONвЂ™S wrist breaks as Artus beats an arm wrestling match. The pirates jeer at the GoonвЂ™s dangling arm as he stumbles away from the table. Conan arrives, mugs of ale in hand, and laughing in mock- challenge, takes the GoonвЂ™s place. Now Artus and Conan arm wrestle, and the two muscled hulk battle to a tie. Slave girls and pirates cheer them on. Then Conan cheats, hurling ale in ArtusвЂ™s face, and as friend flinches, Conan drives his arm to the table. Conan laughs in triumph, until Artus SLUGS HIM IN THE FAC Artus ROARS with laughter as his friend shakes off the bl

I still win.  20 SLAVE GIRL #1 chugs her ale, the foam gushing over her ch and dribbling off her breasts, where Conan happily laps i up. Another SLAVE GIRL # 2 runs her fingers admiringly ov his MUSCLES.
You are as strong as Crom himself! Artus stands from the table and speaks to all...
When I first met him, he was no bigger than you. Just a scrawny little rat picking pockets in Zamora.
(slinking into Conan) Is it true? The girls listen in rapt attention, and SLAVE GIRL writhe like a showgirl.
But even so, it was he who stole The ElephantвЂ™s Heart and slew the sorcerer Yara. The girls SQUEAL in delighted disbelief.
(impressed) That was YOU?

WhoвЂ™s next?! There are no takers for the empty seat across from Conan. Suddenly an wily thief, ELA SHAN, ducks into the alehouse glancing over his shoulder as if pursued. This rogue in a eye patch tries to lose himself in the raucous crowd. Seeing only one empty seat, Ela Shan cuts through the drinking and fornication, and sits across from Conan. Conan drops his elbow to the table, hand open, offering t challenge. The skeptical crowd reacts with wild laughter. ELA SHAN swallows, hides his face and puts his own arm on table, accepting the match with trepidation. As the arm wrestling begins, Conan hams it up for the cro grunting and huffing as if his opponent were Hercules.  21 Conan allows Ela to push his arm closer and closer to the table, but then using only his index finger, he pushes ba to center. The slave girls root and cheer! The anxious thief looks to the entrance and sees... The CITY GUARD, THREE heavyweights in armor, scan the cro The Captain of the Guard, a corpulent man in a strange ma that covers his nose, points directly at the thief. Conan squints through haze at the Captain, catching only glimpses through the mob. HeвЂ™s familiar: The distinctiv he rolls his neck. The mask that covers his nose. But after dispatching his men, the Captain of the Guard s into a waiting chariot and is gone. ConanвЂ™s face goes dark - the same grim intensity we saw the boy. Could it be the same man? Conan looks down at the MANACLES clamped to Ela ShanвЂ™s wrists. Conan smiles, grips the thief harder, even as Ela tries to pry free and run. The guards get closer and closer.

TheyвЂ™1l be happy to take us both to prison, if you donвЂ™t let go! Conan smiles and nods. Just as the surly Guards reach the CRUNCH! Conan slams his head back, breaking Guard #1'вЂ™s sending him stumbling backwards. The crowd is shocked. Artus looks up in confusion. Conan BURSTS UP FROM THE TABLE as Guard #2 charges.
